title: Trump to meet Putin on Aug 15: Talks to take place in Alaska; focus on ending Ukraine war
content: President Donald Trump announced a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15, 2025, to discuss ending the ongoing war in Ukraine. This marks Putin's first visit to the US in a decade, signaling a potential shift in diplomatic efforts. Trump expressed optimism about brokering a peace deal, despite previous failed talks between Moscow and Kyiv.

title: ‘Not to occupy but free Gaza’: Netanyahu defends Israel's military plans
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared Israel's aim to "free" Gaza from Hamas and establish a peaceful civilian government, excluding Hamas, the Palestinian Authority, or any terrorist organization. This statement follows the approval of a military plan involving control of Gaza City, sparking international criticism.

title: Heavy rain in Delhi-NCR: Flights delayed, roads waterlogged; IMD warns of more showers
content: Delhi and the NCR experienced heavy rainfall on Saturday, leading to flight delays and cancellations, with approximately 90 flights affected and several areas waterlogged. The IMD has forecast continued thunderstorms and rain throughout the day in the capital.

title: IPL: CSK may free up purse to add firepower; Dhoni likely to play
content: Chennai Super Kings are planning a significant rebuild after a disappointing IPL season, potentially releasing seasoned players like R Ashwin and Devon Conway to free up approximately Rs 34.45 cr for the upcoming auction. CSK aims to bolster their batting lineup with a top-order hitter, a strong Indian middle-order batsman, and a quality all-rounder.

title: Operation Akhal enters day 9: Two soldiers killed in J&K's Kulgam
content: An ongoing encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district, under Operation Akhal, has resulted in the death of two soldiers, confirmed by the Army on Saturday. The operation, initiated on August 1, has also led to the killing of two unidentified terrorists.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's entire 42,000 employees
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: Rahane hails Bumrah's courage: 'Sometimes players convey message and get dropped'
content: Ajinkya Rahane praised Jasprit Bumrah's transparent communication regarding his workload management for the England Test series. Bumrah's decision to play only three Tests, despite being a key player, demonstrated his commitment to the team's needs. Rahane advised the management to use Bumrah in shorter spells to ensure his availability for future series, highlighting his impact on England's 'Bazball' approach.

title: Happy Raksha Bandhan: 70+ wishes, messages, quotes & more - check here
content: Raksha Bandhan 2025 is a time to cherish the unique bond shared with siblings, often our first rivals and greatest supporters. This day offers a chance to pause and remember childhood memories, reminding our partners-in-crime of their enduring significance. The celebration emphasizes love, protection, and the unbreakable connection that withstands distance and life's changes.

title: 'Short tempered': Huma Qureshi cousin murdered in Delhi - accused brothers known for picking fights
content: In Delhi's Jangpura, Asif Qureshi, cousin of actress Huma Qureshi, was fatally stabbed following a parking dispute with brothers Ujjawal and Gautam. The altercation escalated after Qureshi asked Ujjawal to move his scooter, leading to a violent confrontation. Both brothers, known for their aggressive temper and prior history of altercations, have been arrested by the police.

title: ChatGPT's Saiyaara climax: Alternate ending revealed; very different from the original
content: For their movie Saiyaara's ending, the filmmakers surprisingly consulted ChatGPT, an AI chatbot. The team was looking for a perfect balance between drama and realism. Although one of the AI-generated endings, a bittersweet parting at a train station, initially intrigued them, the filmmakers ultimately opted for a more culturally nuanced and emotionally resonant conclusion crafted by human writers.

title: ‘Will kill anyone working with Salman Khan’: Kapil Sharma's café shooting
content: Comedian Kapil Sharma is now under threat from the Lawrence Bishnoi syndicate due to his connection with Salman Khan. This follows a shooting at Sharma's restaurant in Canada, claimed by the Bishnoi gang. An audio clip reveals threats against those working with Khan, vowing violence, even murder, using AK-47s.

title: Marathi vs non-Marathi row: MNS men assault idli vendor in Kalyan; heated spat erupts on train
content: Recent incidents highlight the Marathi versus non-Marathi divide in Maharashtra. In Kalyan, MNS workers allegedly assaulted an idli vendor for derogatory remarks. A video from a local train shows a heated argument between two women over language preference. Police have not received formal complaints in either case. The incidents underscore existing tensions in the state.

title: Watch: When Pandya dismissed Haider Ali, Pakistani cricketer arrested on rape charges
content: Pakistani cricketer Haider Ali has been arrested in Manchester on rape charges stemming from an alleged incident on July 23, 2025. Greater Manchester Police are investigating, and Ali has been released on bail. His young career so far has included the iconic India vs Pakistan match at the 2022 T20 World Cup but he was unable to make a mark in that contest.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman at GPT-5 launch: ‘India is our second-largest market…but…’
content: OpenAI has launched GPT-5, its most advanced AI model, boasting significant improvements in accuracy, speed, and reasoning. CEO Sam Altman highlighted India as a rapidly growing market, potentially surpassing the US. GPT-5 is available in various sizes and tiers, including a free version, with enhanced versions for Team, Enterprise, Edu, and Pro users, marking a step towards Artificial General Intelligence.

title: India seeks 200 copters to replace ageing Cheetah & Chetak fleet
content: India is urgently seeking to replace its aging Cheetah and Chetak helicopters, which are plagued by safety concerns and outdated technology. The Army has issued a request for information to acquire 120 reconnaissance and surveillance helicopters, while the IAF needs 80, aiming to modernize its fleet and enhance operational capabilities after decades of delays.

title: 'Could have used better language': Ex-Aussie star weighs in on Gambhir–curator clash
content: Matthew Hayden commented on Gautam Gambhir's heated exchange with the Oval pitch curator, Lee Fortis, during India's training session. Hayden acknowledged Gambhir's frustration with perceived restrictions but suggested he could have used better language. Greg Blewett echoed the sentiment, recalling similar frustrations and noting the language used wasn't ideal, despite India securing a series-levelling victory.

title: Amid escalation with US, PM Modi and Putin back India-Russia ties
content: Amidst strained US-India relations due to trade disputes over Russian ties, PM Modi and President Putin reaffirmed their commitment to strengthening India-Russia relations. Modi expressed support for resolving the Russia-Ukraine conflict through diplomacy and invited Putin to India for the annual summit.

title: WTC glory needs specialists, not stopgaps — Gambhir must rethink his approach
content: Under Gautam Gambhir, India have played 15 Test matches, winning five and losing eight, including an embarrassing series defeat at home to New Zealand, their first in 12 years. His red-ball tactics have raised eyebrows; his rigidity in prioritising batting depth over balance, and his decision to keep Kuldeep Yadav on the bench, cost India a golden chance to bury the Bazballers once and for all. India did manage to draw the series, thanks to a spirited performance by the extraordinary skills of Mohammed Siraj, but they should have beaten toothless England.

title: India won't bow down to anybody, says Piyush Goyal
content: Piyush Goyal asserted India's resilience, stating it won't bow down to anyone and will capitalize on global trade restructuring. He expressed confidence in India's economic strength and ability to find opportunities amidst crises like potential Trump tariffs. Goyal highlighted India's growing global recognition and attractiveness as a market, dismissing concerns about its economic status.

title: 51-foot-tall statue of Lord Ram unveiled in Canada's Mississauga
content: A towering 51-foot statue of Lord Ram, inspired by the Ayodhya temple, has been unveiled in Mississauga, becoming North America's tallest. Made in Delhi and assembled in Canada, the statue can withstand high winds and is visible from Toronto airport. The inauguration was celebrated by the Hindu community and attended by Canadian politicians, marking a significant spiritual landmark.

title: Watch: Ashwin's cheeky take on IPL rumours leaves Samson, fans in splits
content: Ravichandran Ashwin cleverly addressed IPL trade rumours in a new video, engaging Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson in a humorous exchange about potential team switches. Ashwin joked about trading himself to stay in Kerala, while reports suggest Samson's unhappiness with RR and CSK's interest in signing him. This playful banter turns transfer speculation into lighthearted entertainment for fans.

title: NFL star Tyreek Hill and ex-wife Keeta's baby Capri rushed to ER; now on the mend
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Selena Gomez opens up about Taylor Swift reportedly ending all ties with Blake Lively
content: Amidst personal changes, Taylor Swift's friendship with Blake Lively reportedly ended due to legal issues involving Justin Baldoni. Selena Gomez discussed her long-standing bond with Swift, revealing their shared history of dating Jonas Brothers. Swift and Kelce are expected at Gomez's wedding. Swift has been seen reconnecting with Gomez, while distancing herself from Lively and Ryan Reynolds.

title: Jaz Agassi’s sweet support for dad Andre Agassi — Steffi Graf moment resurfaces
content: Andre Agassi addressed Shore Capital Partner’s Leadership Academy in New York City on July 14, 2025, emphasizing leadership, mindset, and purpose. Following the fireside chat with Jish Bia, Agassi's daughter, Jaz, expressed her admiration on Instagram. Agassi has previously discussed parenting and his efforts to break negative cycles, highlighting his and Steffi Graf's influence on their children.

title: US tariffs: Shoemakers take measured steps
content: India's non-leather footwear industry in Tamil Nadu, a hub for global brands, faces a potential crisis due to a looming 50% US tariff. Brands like Nike and Crocs may pause new export orders, fearing eroded competitiveness compared to Vietnam and Indonesia. Apparel exporters are also pressured to shift US production elsewhere.

title: 'Why not all airlines?' SC junks plea for AI safety audit
content: The Supreme Court has questioned a petition seeking a safety audit of Air India's fleet following a recent incident. Justices rebuked the petitioner, suggesting it was unfair to single out one airline after the Ahmedabad crash.

title: Only 996 of 13.9L allopathic doctors in NMR
content: The National Medical Register, a database for allopathic doctors, faces challenges. Launched in August 2024, it has seen low registration numbers. Out of 13.9 lakh doctors, only 996 have registered. Many applications are pending approval. The initiative aimed to strengthen digital healthcare. Registers for nurses and paramedics are also planned. However, progress is slow.

title: Kim Kardashian ‘chases’ Tom Brady; 'She threw herself at him'; Sofia Vergara romance rumors swir
content: Rumors swirl around Tom Brady's love life, linking him to both Kim Kardashian and Sofia Vergara. Sources suggest Kardashian is very interested in Brady, even making her feelings known at Jeff Bezos' wedding. However, Brady and Vergara were spotted dining together, sparking further speculation. While Vergara downplays the relationship as a casual fling, Kardashian reportedly hopes it ends soon.

title: Evander Kane joins star-studded celebration; Draisaitl weds Celeste Desjardins; Oilers unite in style
content: Evander Kane, former Oilers forward, attended Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins' wedding in France, sharing photos on Instagram with a heartfelt message. Accompanied by fiancée Mara Teigen, Kane joined other NHL stars like Connor Brown and Ryan Nugent-Hopkins at the lavish event. Lauren Kyle, Connor McDavid's wife, was a bridesmaid.

title: Congress functionaries back Rahul Gandhi's 'vote chori' accusation, opposition allies join in
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's "vote chori" expose, the Congress party is launching a nationwide campaign to highlight alleged irregularities in the electoral process. State units will screen Rahul's press conference, and Mallikarjun Kharge will discuss a national offensive on "election fraud" with party leaders.

title: Rahul Gandhi's 'false narrative' rejected thrice, will be ignored again: BJP
content: BJP refuted Rahul Gandhi's rigging allegations in Maharashtra polls, stating Congress won seats with increased voter turnout. Union Minister Bhupender Yadav cited Election Commission data, clarifying a 40 lakh voter increase, not one crore as claimed.

title: Monsoon session: Parliament proceedings washed out again amid opposition stir
content: Both Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha faced disruptions due to opposition protests demanding a discussion on Bihar's special intensive revision of electoral rolls. The deputy chairman of Rajya Sabha rejected notices for suspending business, leading to uproar and adjournment. Despite the chaos in Lok Sabha, some questions were addressed, and the Income Tax Bill, 2025 was withdrawn for revision.

title: NOTA can't be treated as candidate, Centre tells SC
content: The Centre has strongly opposed the Supreme Court's examination of whether 'NOTA' can be a rival candidate when only one candidate is contesting. The government argues that 'NOTA' is merely an option, not a candidate under the Representation of the People Act, 1951. They also clarified that the right to vote arises only when a poll involves multiple candidates.

title: EC increases remuneration, honorarium for poll duty staffers
content: The Election Commission has increased the remuneration for officials and staff involved in conducting elections. Presiding officers will now receive Rs 500 daily, while polling officers will get Rs 400 per day or a lump sum of Rs 1,600.

title: 'I’d have to get the police involved': Dwyane Wade revealed why his first marriage fell apart
content: Dwyane Wade's personal life faced turmoil before his marriage to Gabrielle Union. His previous marriage to Siohvaughn Funches ended in 2008 amidst accusations of domestic violence and a difficult co-parenting relationship. Wade and Union briefly separated in 2013, during which he fathered a child with another woman, but they reconciled and married in 2014.

title: SC to examine validity of BNS 'sedition' provision
content: The Supreme Court is set to review the constitutional validity of Section 152 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), which deals with sedition. A petition challenging the provision, filed by retired Maj Gen S G Vombatkere, argues it mirrors the contentious Section 124A of the IPC.

title: 'Tired script': EC slams Rahul's 'vote theft' claim; cites 2018 SC decision
content: The Election Commission (EC) has strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegations of voter fraud, labeling them a repetition of old, baseless claims. The EC challenged Gandhi to either substantiate his accusations with formal verification or apologize to the nation.

title: ‘Rudrastra’: India’s longest freight train with 354 wagons hits tracks; Watch video
content: Indian Railways has launched 'Rudrastra,' its longest freight train ever, stretching 4.5 kilometers. Composed of 354 wagons and powered by seven locomotives, the train was formed by linking six standard rakes. It journeyed from Ganjkhwaja to Garhwa Road, covering 200 km at an average speed of 40 km/h.

title: Shubman Gill's mic-drop moment: 'I want to be the best'
content: Shubman Gill's stellar performance in England, amassing 754 runs and leading as the top scorer, has garnered praise, with Dinesh Karthik highlighting his technical improvements and composed media handling. Gill addressed doubts about his overseas form with conviction, notably shining in the second Test at Edgbaston with a double century and a hundred.

title: Billy Howton former Green Bay Packers star and NFLPA founder passes away at 95
content: Billy Howton, the Green Bay Packers' legendary wide receiver and NFL Players Association founder, passed away at 95. He revolutionized the game, becoming the first rookie to achieve over 1,000 receiving yards. Howton's efforts to establish the NFL Players Association secured better rights and pensions for players, leaving a lasting legacy.

title: Lions' Norris stable after injury ends game early
content: The preseason game between the Lions and Falcons was suspended in the fourth quarter Friday night after Lions safety Morice Norris was taken off the field in an ambulance.

title: Sanders impresses for Browns, felt 'comfortable'
content: Cleveland Browns quarterback Shedeur Sanders didn't disappoint in his highly anticipated NFL preseason debut against the Carolina Panthers.

title: Brady 'honored' as statue unveiled outside Gillette
content: The New England Patriots unveiled a 12-foot bronze statue of Tom Brady outside Gillette Stadium on Friday.

title: Panthers' Legette, Browns' Jenkins DQ'd for brawl
content: Panthers wide receiver Xavier Legette, who is coming off an underwhelming rookie season, was disqualified from Friday's preseason opener along with Browns safety Rayshawn Jenkins.

title: Fever lose Colson, McDonald for rest of season
content: Indiana Fever guards Sydney Colson and Aari McDonald will both miss the remainder of the 2025 season after suffering season-ending injuries Thursday in the Fever's 95-60 loss at the Phoenix Mercury, the team announced Friday.

title: Geno, Crosby flash obscene gestures at hecklers
content: Las Vegas Raiders quarterback Geno Smith and defensive end Maxx Crosby were caught on video making obscene gestures toward Seattle Seahawks fans.

title: Free agent Beasley, in gambling inquiry, evicted
content: NBA free agent Malik Beasley, who is under investigation in a federal gambling probe, was evicted from his high-rise apartment in Detroit on Wednesday, according to court records.

title: 1st-pitch bets face possible Ohio ban amid probe
content: Ohio regulators are mulling a ban on offering so-called microbets, including betting markets on first pitches in MLB, amid a gambling investigation into two Cleveland Guardians pitchers.

title: 12 colleges stacked with NFL draft talent: Why scouts are watching Penn State, Clemson this season
content: Which schools have the best talent for next year's draft? We picked 12 must-watch rosters loaded with potential future first-rounders.

title: How the Indiana Fever adjust to season-ending injuries to Colson, McDonald
content: With Caitlin Clark out, the backcourt was already depleted. How will losing two guards impact the Fever's playoff race?

title: Caitlin Clark and 13 more impact WNBA players for playoff (or future) success
content: The margin for error is shrinking as the playoffs approach. Who will be the difference-makers for their teams?

title: Do the Cubs have a championship-level roster? Here's what MLB insiders think
content: After a trade deadline that was more mild than wild, we asked around the sport to see if the Cubs have enough to win big.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in fantasy football drafts.

title: Does NFL success and fame translate to college football success? These schools are betting it does
content: With high expectations for this new wave of celebrity coaches that includes Eddie George, reputation can take these leaders only so far.

title: Can Wrexham's Hollywood fairy tale continue in Championship, or is rude awakening ahead?
content: Celebrity owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac said Wrexham will reach the Premier League -- but the closer they get, the more unrealistic it is.

title: After four tumultuous years away from MMA, is McGregor staging a comeback?
content: Conor McGregor wants to fight at the White House in 2026 and has begun drug testing. Can a comeback really happen?

title: 'I'm made for it': Austin Simmons gets his shot at Ole Miss
content: At 19, the two-sport star has already graduated from Ole Miss, but he's getting his first chance to start at QB.

title: When will Cooper Flagg be an All-Star? Projecting the No. 1 pick's NBA future
content: How many MVPs and titles for Cooper Flagg? When can Dallas expect success with him? ESPN experts predict his NBA future.

title: UFC Fight Night: Expert picks, best bets for Dolidze vs. Hernandez
content: MMA expert Din Thomas picks Dolidze vs. Hernandez and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: Week 11 preview: What's at stake in the final regular-season weekend?
content: The PLL heads to Boston, with three playoff spots open. Here's the game schedule, clinching scenarios, more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye move for Lookman
content: Arsenal are looking to make a move for Atalanta winger Ademola Lookman. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 1.0: Early picks for Pochettino's team
content: With players focusing on the looming European club season, nine months remain before World Cup squads are announced. Who will be on the U.S.'s?

title: Texas to Pennsylvania: Can you ace the last 'SportsCenter' 50-in-50 quiz?
content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

title: Two soldiers killed as security forces continue operations in J&K’s Kulgam
content: Chinar Corps pays tribute to Lance Naik Pritpal Singh and Sepoy Harminder Singh, who laid down their lives in the line of duty

title: Security forces arrest six people in Manipur for extortion
content: One active cadre of the banned Peoples' Liberation Army was arrested on Friday from Huikap Makha Leikai in Imphal East district

title: Trump again claims that he helped 'settle' tensions between India, Pakistan
content: They were going at it, they were going at it big, and they were two great leaders that came together just prior to what would have been a tremendous conflict, as you know, a nuclear conflict, probably, says U.S. President Donald Trump

title: Pro-Khalistan graffiti found at several locations in Amritsar, juvenile among 2 held
content: Commissioner of Police (CP) Amritsar Gurpreet Singh Bhullar said the two were lured into spraying Pro-Khalistan slogans in exchange for monetary rewards, which were never delivered.

title: What makes monsoon the best season for train journeys in India
content: From misty Konkan cliffs to cloud-draped coffee valleys, India’s boutique trains are offering the season’s most scenic escapes, no umbrellas required.

title: Planning a monsoon break? Here’s why South Goa should top your list
content: From forest picnics to sea caves, tribal encounters to tavern trails, Ssouth Goa is emerging as a gentler monsoon escape.

title: India monsoon LIVE: IMD issues fresh warning of rainfall in Himachal Pradesh; red alert for most parts of Delhi-NCR
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a heavy rainfall alert in three Telangana districts for Saturday

title: BJP MPs Nishikant Dubey, Manoj Tiwari booked for forcibly entering Baidyanath Temple's inner chamber
content: The “forcible entry” by the MPs and “scuffle” with policemen resulted in causing fear and panic among thousands of devotees present and a stampede-like situation, as per the complaint.

title: Supreme Court stays M.P. High Court order in Saif Ali Khan family property dispute
content: A Bench comprising Justices P.S. Narasimha and Atul Chandurkar issued notice on a plea of Omar Faruq Ali and Raashid Ali, descendants of the elder brother of Nawab Hamidullah Khan, against the High Court’s order of June 30.

title: J&K government grapples with stinky meat problem, seizes around four tonnes of unsafe mutton
content: A Valley-wide crackdown was sparked after 1,200 kilograms of rotten meat was seized by the Food Safety Department from a cold storage facility operating within the Zakura Industrial Estate in Srinagar on August 2.

title: Rain lashes parts of Delhi, some areas waterlogged as ‘thunderstorm with rain’ forecast
content: IMD has issued a fresh warning of continued rainfall activity in Himachal Pradesh, with heavy rain expected in many parts of the State over the next few days.

title: India embarks on indigenous green hydrogen shipbuilding mission
content: Cochin Shipyard Limited and Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited are currently building one ship each, powered entirely by hydrogen fuel cells developed using indigenous technology, Union Minister for Ports and Shipping Sarbananda Sonowal tells Lok Sabha

title: When the written sentence travelled
content: In the 1980s, trunk calls had to be booked to speak to someone back in the village or a distant town. Telegrams had to be fired to break the news of a death or drop a wish for a ‘happy married life’. And registered post was the preferred medium to send valuable documents

title: Andhra Pradesh will be dump yard-free State in three years, says Urban Development Minister Narayana
content: The previous government left a legacy garbage of of 85 lakh tonnes, and 65 lakh tonnes of it  has been removed so far, he says

title: Andhra Pradesh sees major boost in road infrastructure under CRIF: Nitin Gadkari
content: In the past three years, including the current financial year, the State has seen 20 State road projects completed, spanning 691 km at a cost of 535 crore, and 55 more projects, covering 534 km, are currently underway with a sanctioned cost of ₹1,256 crore, he tells Lok Sabha

title: Four die in Karnataka after taking herbal medicine from traditional healer for alcohol de-addiction
content: Traditional healer Fakirappa of Imadapur village in Kalaburagi district arrested and sent to judicial custody following a police complaint

title: CM Naidu to attend International Tribal Day celebrations in ASR district
content: Besides participating in traditional cultural events, the Chief Minister will visit tribal households to understand their living conditions and interact with coffee growers

title: Pune to have three new municipal corporations, says DCM Ajit Pawar
content: Mr. Pawar pointed out that planned development can be achieved with new municipal corporations in place

title: Attack on migrants has received national attention, will be sorted out, says WB Governor
content: The remarks by the Governor assume significance as thousands of migrants from the State have been detained and harassed in the BJP-ruled States

title: Mahayuti takes a dig at Uddhav Thackeray over last-row seating in INDIA Bloc meet
content: BJP says it reflects the importance given to Thackeray in the alliance, Shiv Sena holds satirical protest at memorial of its party founder Balasaheb Thackeray, asking for ‘forgiveness’ for his son

title: Let Election Commission itself submit an affidavit, says Ashok Gehlot
content: Mr. Gehlot said that the Election Commission had made an “absurd demand” despite knowing the fact that Mr. Gandhi was working under an oath to uphold the Constitution which inherently included strengthening the constitutional institutions.

title: In the name of a nation: The Bengali migrant worker and Indian citizenship
content: As thousands of Bengali-speaking migrants across some of India’s States are questioned on their citizenship, detained, or pushed into Bangladesh, a wave of fear has brought them back to West Bengal. Shiv Sahay Singh explores the reasons for the migration, as the controversy opens up the debate about Bengali identity. Political parties use the crisis as a plank for the Assembly elections in 2026

title: Fee regulation Bill ignores audits, backs schools: Atishi
content: Recalling the previous AAP government’s efforts to regulate fee hikes, she said her party in 2015 had sent the fee hike Bill to the Central government, but it was not approved.

title: Parents of R.G. Kar victim to lead march to West Bengal  Secretariat to mark one year of the crime
content: Family sends invitations to political parties except Trinamool; police issue prohibitory orders, mark Howrah’s Santragachi Bus Stand and Kolkata’s Rani Rashmoni Avenue as alternative venues for rally

title: State Education Policy: move to scrap board exam for Class XI faces criticism in Tamil Nadu
content: D. Ravikumar, VCK MP, expressed concern that the move would not only adversely affect higher secondary education but also bring down the quality of higher and vocational education.

title: Chief Minister Stalin presents awards to Tamil scholars at Kamban Vizha 2025
content: He says the Dravidian movement viewed the Kamba Ramayana from a different perspective, praising the work for its poetry and the richness of its Tamil

title: Ensure freedom of expression does not hurt religious feelings, Madras HC tells State government
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has set aside the closure of a case registered by the Thoothukudi police over a social media post disrespecting Lord Krishna

title: Stir against SIR a meeting point for Trinamool and Congress
content: The Trinamool Congress has often said that it is the only party in the INDIA bloc to not have an electoral alliance with the Congress. However, at a dinner meet hosted by Rahul Gandhi, the two sides seemed to have turned a page

title: SEP panel recommends two-language policy, Kannada/mother tongue as medium of instruction
content: The SEP has proposed to mandate Kannada/mother tongue as the medium of instruction at least until Class 5, and preferably up to Class 12 (II PUC)

title: 2 Soldiers Killed In Action During Encounter With Terrorists In J&K's Kulgam
content: Two soldiers were killed in an encounter with terrorists that broke out on Friday night in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam, the army said on Saturday.

title: "Trump Destroying Himself": Top US Economist To NDTV On Tariff War With India
content: US President Donald Trump is "destroying himself" by launching a trade war against the rest of the world, American Economist and John Hopkins University Professor Steve Hanke told NDTV.

title: ISRO Announces Successful Static Test Of Skyroot's KALAM 1200 Rocket Motor
content: ISRO on Friday announced that Skyroot Aerospace has successfully carried out the first static test of its powerful KALAM 1200 solid rocket motor, the first stage of the Vikram-1 launch vehicle, at the Satish Dhawan Space Centre (SDSC), Sriharikota.

title: Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Waterlogging, Airlines Issue Advisory
content: Heavy rain has brought Delhi-NCR to a standstill on Saturday morning, leaving many areas waterlogged and affecting vehicular traffic.

title: "Why Target Air India Only": Supreme Court Junks Plea For Safety Audit
content: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to hear a plea to appoint a retired top court judge for examining Air India's safety practices among other aspects and asked the petitioner why target the airline that witnessed an "unfortunate tragedy".

title: Azerbaijan, Armenia Back Trump's Nobel Peace Prize Nomination After Peace Deal
content: Christian-majority Armenia and Muslim-majority Azerbaijan have feuded for decades over their border and the status of ethnic enclaves within each other's territories.

title: Assam Students Body Protests Against Government's Directive On Hindu Migrants
content: The All Assam Students' Union (AASU) staged statewide protests on Friday at district headquarters, strongly opposing the Assam government's reported directive to withdraw all citizenship-related cases against illegal Hindu migrants.

title: Himachal 'Jodidar' Brothers Break Silence Over Marrying Same Woman
content: The two Himachal Pradesh brothers who married the same woman have defended their decision, saying the public criticism did not affect them, adding they took pride in the centuries-old tradition of the Hatti clan.

title: Cloudburst In Himachal Pradesh's Kullu, No Casualties Reported
content: An incident of cloudburst was reported in the Sharod Nala area of Kullu in Himachal Pradesh on Friday as per the information received from the Central Water Commission, Mohal.

title: Police Officer, Suspect Dead After Shooting At Atlanta's Emory University
content: A man opened fire outside the headquarters of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta on Friday, leaving bullet impacts in windows across the sprawling campus and killing a police officer before he was found dead.

title: 10 Bangladeshi Infiltrators Sent Back From Assam
content: As part of an ongoing crackdown on illegal immigration, Assam Police on Friday sent back 10 Bangladeshi infiltrators from the Sribhumi area in Karimganj district along the Indo-Bangladesh border.

title: "Not Going To Occupy Gaza, Will Free It From Hamas": Netanyahu Amid Backlash
content: Netanyahu said that the territory's demilitarisation and the establishment of "a peaceful civilian administration would help free our hostages" and prevent future threats.

title: Trump Says He Will Meet Putin "Very Shortly"
content: US President Donald Trump said Friday he would meet "very shortly" with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, and suggested that a deal between Moscow and Kyiv could involve swapping territory held by the two sides.

title: Trump, Putin To Meet On August 15 In Alaska To Discuss Ukraine Peace Deal
content: Vladimir Putin held consultations on Friday with PM Modi and China's Xi Jinping ahead of the summit with Donald Trump.

title: US At Risk Of Losing India As Strategic Partner: Ex-Official Amid Trump Tariff Row
content: Former US Undersecretary of Commerce for International Trade and senior foreign policy expert, Christopher Padilla, has warned that the ongoing trade tensions could pose a risk of long-term damage to the India-US relationship.

title: Trump Seeks $1 Billion From University Of California-Los Angeles
content: President Donald Trump demanded a massive $1 billion fine from the prestigious University of California system on Friday as the administration pushed its claims of antisemitism in UCLA's response to 2024 student protests related to Gaza.

title: NSA Ajit Doval Meets Russia Deputy PM, Discusses Defence, Strategic Projects
content: Russia's First Deputy Prime Minister Denis Manturov held a meeting with India's National Security Advisor Ajit Kumar Doval, focusing on defense and strategic cooperation between the two countries, the Russian embassy announced on Friday.

title: Jim Lovell, Commander Of NASA's Apollo 13 Moon Mission, Dies At 97
content: -American astronaut Jim Lovell, commander of the failed 1970 mission to the moon that nearly ended in disaster but became an inspirational saga of survival and the basis for the hit movie "Apollo 13," has died at the age of 97, NASA said on Friday.

title: Meitei Alliance, Thadou Tribe Body Call For More Meetings For Peace In Manipur
content: The top umbrella body of Meitei civil society organisations from across the globe has called for frequent meetings of all communities in Manipur to bring understanding, peace and rule of law.

title: Man Gets Life Imprisonment For Raping 2-Year-Old Cousin In 2022
content: A local court here sentenced a man to life imprisonment for raping a two-year-old girl in 2022, an official said on Friday.

title: Rajnath postpones U.S. visit; defence purchases unaffected
content: Minister was to go to U.S. this month-end to boost defence ties with the signing of a 10-year plan; officials reject reports that India has stopped defence purchases from U.S. in response to tariff row

title: Government approves MERITE scheme to strengthen technical institutes
content: The scheme, with an outlay of ₹4,200 crore for five years, aims to develop guidelines for multidisciplinary programmes in technical courses, and increase learning and employability skills

title: Indrakeeladri to host mass Varalakshmi Vratham on August 22
content: The presiding deity atop Indrakeeladri Goddess Kanaka Durga adorned and worshipped as Sri Varalakshmi Devi on the occasion of “Sravana Masam Vara Lakshmi Devi pooja”

title: Left parties to observe protest day on August 28 against power tariff hikes, smart meters
content: Date marks 25 years since 2000 electricity reforms stir; parties also slam government for aiding private steel projects over Visakha Steel Plant.

title: Russia is not Iran, India can’t cancel oil imports on U.S. demand: experts
content: Former Ambassador to Washington says Trump tariffs, penalty reviving ‘bitter memories’ of previous U.S. coercive actions

title: Madras High Court restrains functioning of office-bearers appointed by DMK to MTC trade union without conducting elections
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu grants the interim injunction pursuant to a civil suit filed by 59 members of Metropolitan Transport Corporation Oozhiyar Progressive Union

title: Andhra Pradesh records 52% kharif sowing amid rainfall deficit
content: Principal crop paddy sees sowing in 8.11 lakh hectares reaching 55% of seasonal target, maize, ragi, bajra performing well with sowing percentages of 88, 89, and 72 respectively; Chittoor district leads State with 167% of its seasonal normal area sown

title: Police rescue baby hours after father sells her away for ₹5,000 to a couple
content: The accused who bought the three-year-old planned to maim her and use her for seeking alms, say railway police

title: KHB plans a mega sports centre in Surya City to house a cricket stadium of 80,000 seating capacity
content: This will likely be the second largest cricket stadium in the country after the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, which has a seating capacity of 1,32,000

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: Rescue efforts at Dharali continue, heavy rain forecast
content: Administration deploys thermal imaging cameras and sniffer dogs to look for survivors; residents from nearby village say toll could be higher as 50 labourers were working at a site when the flash flood struck

title: Rights panel asks home dept. to decide on estimate for maintenance of water tank in Ernakulam district jail
content: SHRC Chairman directs the Additional Chief Secretary (Home department) to decide on the matter within a month of receiving the estimate from the head of the Prison dept.

title: Kerala HC denies life convict’s plea for emergency parole
content: Most fundamental rights of convicts remain suspended after conviction and cannot be diluted by granting emergency leave regularly, except in truly extraordinary situations, the court observes

title: Task force for well-being of students unveils portal
content: Initiative seeks views from students, parents, faculty, experts and public to inform report to apex court

title: Akshaya entrepreneurs in Ernakulam suspend K-Smart services over low service charges
content: Service fees were revised only once in 23 years, say entrepreneurs, who argue that ₹50 for a 30-minute ownership change or ₹70 for a 45-minute marriage registration is unsustainable

title: Sharp drop in child labour cases in Andhra Pradesh, say officials
content: Stricter enforcement of laws, rehabilitation of rescued children, and better coordination among departments drive the decline, while officials urge continued vigilance to end the practice completely

title: High Court issues notices to CCLA
content: Petitioners challenged the order passed by the Chief Commission of Land Administration declaring two parcels of land in Sulthanpally village as government lands

title: Bombay High Court orders reinstatement of 53 contract workers terminated in 1995
content: Calling the denial of reinstatement a “grave travesty of justice,” the Bombay High Court has directed the Thane Municipal Corporation to reinstate 53 contract workers terminated in 1995.

title: Punjab’s land pooling policy faces question over intent, transparency from stakeholders
content: Farmer unions, political parties, and academics question transparency and intent; High Court grants interim stay

title: Hyderabad flood solution | Divert rain water to nalas and tanks, connect them to Musi: Telangana CM
content: Revanth Reddy directs officials to take steps to see that flood water is discharged into Musi and expedite works on rejuvenation of tanks and widening of nalas

title: Kerala should show the way in fight to protect equality, secularism, says Brinda Karat at P. Govinda Pillai centenary
content: Amid Sangh Parivar’s increasing attacks on secularism and attempts at rewriting history, it is important to take forward the legacy of PG, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan.

title: ASHAs to take out march for implementation of Centre’s incentive hike
content: Association says State government has said many times that it will hike the honorarium when the Centre does so

title: Rahul Gandhi is risking his credibility, alleges BJP
content: Responding to Mr. Gandhi’s allegations, Union Minister and BJP leader Bhupender Yadav said that in the Maharashtra 2024 Assembly election, the Congress and allies had, in fact, won most of the seats where the votes had increased.

title: HC permits Sidharthan’s family to withdraw compensation amount of ₹7 lakh
content: The 20-year-old student was found dead at the College of Veterinary and Animal Sciences in Wayanad in February 2024, allegedly following ragging

title: Mahadevapura has seen allegations over electoral roll manipulation earlier too
content: Activists are seeking a through investigation into the allegations by EC without politicising the issue

title: Nannaya varsity staff, 4 students booked for defaming student
content: The victim lodged a police complaint after two in-house committees failed to address the issue since January

title: Day after Rahul Gandhi’s ‘expose’, access to voter rolls hits a snag
content: An error message saying “Warning: Success” appeared when The Hindu attempted to download rolls from Delhi and Goa; the rolls were available after the EC posted a ‘fact check’ on social media

title: SC seeks Centre’s response on plea alleging apathy towards persons with autistic spectrum disorders
content: Staff at airports, railway stations and metro services need to be sensitised to the issue, says petitioner

title: Assam CM accuses Mamata of creating NRC fear for political gain
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said his West Bengal counterpart has been raking up the issue with the 2026 Assembly elections in mind

title: Koratagere murder mystery deepens as police discover severed head of woman
content: A senior police officer overseeing the investigations told The Hindu they suspected that the body parts were of a woman, and it was confirmed after discovering the severed head

title: No declaration on oath? Then apologise: EC official to Rahul
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. title: 🏈 Fantasy Draft Guide: Rankings, mock, analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Browns QB Shedeur Sanders impresses in debut
content: shedeur Sanders throws for two touchdowns in his first preseason game with the browns . the 2025 preseason kicked off Thursday and continued Friday with several rookies playing their first snaps, whether they are rookies or offseason purchases .

title: Community Shield will tell us whether Liverpool are the team to beat
content: arne slot has assembled "a really strong" squad going into the new season . the champions' 2025-26 campaign begins in earnest at home to Bournemouth on august 15 . it is a tradition that dates back more than a century .

title: NBA's new financial rules threaten dynasties: 'Harder choices' for top teams
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . since the Warriors won back-to-back titles in 2017 and 2018, the NBA has seen seven different champions hoist the Larry O'Brien Trophy . there have been 11 different finalists in each of the past six postseasons .

title: Power Rankings: Who's the best team in baseball right now?

title: PPR rankings: Top 100 for 2025
content: field Yates' 2025 fantasy football rankings will be updated throughout the preseason to reflect any changes in his view on players for the upcoming season . the rankings below are for PPR formats . he explains how Stefon Diggs could bounce back and put up big numbers in fantasy .
